sentence.Network_en: A brouhaha by the football players resulted in three black eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 足球队员们因小事发生争吵结果有三人被打得鼻青脸肿.

sentence.Network_en: The brouhaha comes as TBWA pitching to retain ad duties for Visa.
sentence.Network_cn: 李岱艾打算暂缓投放维萨的广告引发了一些骚动.

sentence.Network_en: Is all this brouhaha justified? In the short term, yes.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有这些过度兴奋的情绪正常 吗 ?短期内, 是的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: brotherliness 兄弟情谊brouhaha 骚动brow 表情
brought 带来brouhaha 吵闹brouter 路由器

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from French, probably imitative

entry.tran: （由某事引起的）喧嚷，吵闹，骚动
entry.def: A brouhaha is an excited and critical fuss or reaction to something.

example.ex: ...the recent brouhaha over a congressional pay raise.
example.tran: 最近因国会加薪引起的风波

means.word_mean: 1. loud confused noise from many sources
2. a confused disturbance far greater than its cause merits

auth_sentence.content: Jemima Kiss delightfully describes the debate as a "brouhaha".
auth_sentence.res_content: Jemima Kiss delightfully describes the debate as a "brouhaha".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Jemima Kiss delightfully describes the debate as a "brouhaha".

auth_sentence.content: It is almost madness, says Riva, sounding a tad censorious about all the red-carpet brouhaha.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is almost madness, says Riva, sounding a tad censorious about all the red-carpet brouhaha.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is almost madness, says Riva, sounding a tad censorious about all the red-carpet brouhaha.

auth_sentence.content: In retrospect, the cowboy brouhaha was like the weather: something ephemeral to deplore.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: In retrospect, the cowboy brouhaha was like the weather: something ephemeral to deplore.
